content.value: Advanced shell scripting involves using conditions, loops, and functions to create more powerful, flexible, and reusable Linux scripts.

Basic scripts run commands in sequence, but real-world automation often requires decision-making, repetition, and organization. Advanced scripting features allow scripts to respond to different situations, process large amounts of data, and perform complex administrative tasks automatically.
Conditional statements allow a script to make decisions based on conditions.
The if statement executes commands only if a condition is true.

content.command: [ if [ -f file.txt ] then echo "File exists" fi ]
